definition[0]: like-for-like figures have been changed where necessary so that a correct comparison can be made with a previous period
example[0]: There was no real growth in like-for-like sales, with the new store space excluded.
definition[1]: if something is replaced on a like-for-like basis, it is replaced with something that is the same
example[1]: We should ensure that we are replacing on a like-for-like basis and not giving the insured a superior item containing advanced features.
